content:
This I did over the weekend:

Half of my laundry
Changed the sheets
Medicated the cat
Watched the cat's recovery
Grocery shopping
Workout (heavy) at the gym
Ordered some camera lenses for the staycation next week
Ordered a new light weight comforter
Listen to the rainfall
Updated my Google Docs personal journal
Nap a lot

Things I should have done over the weekend:

Clean the garage
Sharpen the chainsaw
Organize and throw out or donate old clothing
Done the other half of my laundry
Clean out the wood burning stove and set for another burn Gone for a short walk (hike)
Butcher the tomato plants

content:
A properly plugged well emits about the same as a single cow (40g of methane an hour). Bad wells emit up to 75000g per hour ...

#Colorado #EndFossilFuels #ClimateEmergency

-------------
The worst wells were the newer recently abandoned wells. These wells were not abandoned because the owner ran into operating problems or went bankrupt.

It is very frustrating to know that the gas and oil industry has made their fortune and left behind a very dangerous mess.

content:
This I did over the weekend:

Half of my laundry
Changed the sheets
Medicated the cat
Watched the cat's recovery
Grocery shopping
Workout (heavy) at the gym
Ordered some camera lenses for the staycation next week
Ordered a new light weight comforter
Listen to the rainfall
Updated my Google Docs personal journal
Nap a lot

Things I should have done over the weekend:

Clean the garage
Sharpen the chainsaw
Organize and throw out or donate old clothing
Done the other half of my laundry
Clean out the wood burning stove and set for another burn Gone for a short walk (hike)
Butcher the tomato plants

content:
A properly plugged well emits about the same as a single cow (40g of methane an hour). Bad wells emit up to 75000g per hour ...

#Colorado #EndFossilFuels #ClimateEmergency

-------------
The worst wells were the newer recently abandoned wells. These wells were not abandoned because the owner ran into operating problems or went bankrupt.

It is very frustrating to know that the gas and oil industry has made their fortune and left behind a very dangerous mess.

https://coloradosun.com/2023/10/23/methane-emissions-super-emitting-oil-gas-adams-county/

content:
This I did over the weekend:

Half of my laundry
Changed the sheets
Medicated the cat
Watched the cat's recovery
Grocery shopping
Workout (heavy) at the gym
Ordered some camera lenses for the staycation next week
Ordered a new light weight comforter
Listen to the rainfall
Updated my Google Docs personal journal
Nap a lot

Things I should have done over the weekend:

Clean the garage
Sharpen the chainsaw
Organize and throw out or donate old clothing
Done the other half of my laundry
Clean out the wood burning stove and set for another burn Gone for a short walk (hike)
Butcher the tomato plants

content:
A properly plugged well emits about the same as a single cow (40g of methane an hour). Bad wells emit up to 75000g per hour ...

#Colorado #EndFossilFuels #ClimateEmergency

-------------
The worst wells were the newer recently abandoned wells. These wells were not abandoned because the owner ran into operating problems or went bankrupt.

It is very frustrating to know that the gas and oil industry has made their fortune and left behind a very dangerous mess.

content:
This I did over the weekend:

Half of my laundry
Changed the sheets
Medicated the cat
Watched the cat's recovery
Grocery shopping
Workout (heavy) at the gym
Ordered some camera lenses for the staycation next week
Ordered a new light weight comforter
Listen to the rainfall
Updated my Google Docs personal journal
Nap a lot

Things I should have done over the weekend:

Clean the garage
Sharpen the chainsaw
Organize and throw out or donate old clothing
Done the other half of my laundry
Clean out the wood burning stove and set for another burn Gone for a short walk (hike)
Butcher the tomato plants

content:
A properly plugged well emits about the same as a single cow (40g of methane an hour). Bad wells emit up to 75000g per hour ...

#Colorado #EndFossilFuels #ClimateEmergency

-------------
The worst wells were the newer recently abandoned wells. These wells were not abandoned because the owner ran into operating problems or went bankrupt.

It is very frustrating to know that the gas and oil industry has made their fortune and left behind a very dangerous mess.

https://coloradosun.com/2023/10/23/methane-emissions-super-emitting-oil-gas-adams-county/

content:
This I did over the weekend:

Half of my laundry
Changed the sheets
Medicated the cat
Watched the cat's recovery
Grocery shopping
Workout (heavy) at the gym
Ordered some camera lenses for the staycation next week
Ordered a new light weight comforter
Listen to the rainfall
Updated my Google Docs personal journal
Nap a lot

Things I should have done over the weekend:

Clean the garage
Sharpen the chainsaw
Organize and throw out or donate old clothing
Done the other half of my laundry
Clean out the wood burning stove and set for another burn Gone for a short walk (hike)
Butcher the tomato plants

content:
A properly plugged well emits about the same as a single cow (40g of methane an hour). Bad wells emit up to 75000g per hour ...

#Colorado #EndFossilFuels #ClimateEmergency

-------------
The worst wells were the newer recently abandoned wells. These wells were not abandoned because the owner ran into operating problems or went bankrupt.

It is very frustrating to know that the gas and oil industry has made their fortune and left behind a very dangerous mess.

content:
This I did over the weekend:

Half of my laundry
Changed the sheets
Medicated the cat
Watched the cat's recovery
Grocery shopping
Workout (heavy) at the gym
Ordered some camera lenses for the staycation next week
Ordered a new light weight comforter
Listen to the rainfall
Updated my Google Docs personal journal
Nap a lot

Things I should have done over the weekend:

Clean the garage
Sharpen the chainsaw
Organize and throw out or donate old clothing
Done the other half of my laundry
Clean out the wood burning stove and set for another burn Gone for a short walk (hike)
Butcher the tomato plants

content:
A properly plugged well emits about the same as a single cow (40g of methane an hour). Bad wells emit up to 75000g per hour ...

#Colorado #EndFossilFuels #ClimateEmergency

-------------
The worst wells were the newer recently abandoned wells. These wells were not abandoned because the owner ran into operating problems or went bankrupt.

It is very frustrating to know that the gas and oil industry has made their fortune and left behind a very dangerous mess.

https://coloradosun.com/2023/10/23/methane-emissions-super-emitting-oil-gas-adams-county/

content:
#retrogaming #retrocomputing

Inspired by @damianogerli 's horror graphic adventure posts, I'm considering a new Vintage Vault episode. Exploring a lesser-known, yet intriguing game, 'Produce,' on a genuine Sharp X1 or PC-8801 SR (still deciding). While the game leans more towards strategy, the distinctive role we embody in the story, coupled with its unconventional mechanics, has me utterly captivated... I'm certain it will garner the usual 30 views! Hahaha.

content:
This I did over the weekend:

Half of my laundry
Changed the sheets
Medicated the cat
Watched the cat's recovery
Grocery shopping
Workout (heavy) at the gym
Ordered some camera lenses for the staycation next week
Ordered a new light weight comforter
Listen to the rainfall
Updated my Google Docs personal journal
Nap a lot

Things I should have done over the weekend:

Clean the garage
Sharpen the chainsaw
Organize and throw out or donate old clothing
Done the other half of my laundry
Clean out the wood burning stove and set for another burn Gone for a short walk (hike)
Butcher the tomato plants

content:
#retrogaming #retrocomputing

Inspired by @damianogerli 's horror graphic adventure posts, I'm considering a new Vintage Vault episode. Exploring a lesser-known, yet intriguing game, 'Produce,' on a genuine Sharp X1 or PC-8801 SR (still deciding). While the game leans more towards strategy, the distinctive role we embody in the story, coupled with its unconventional mechanics, has me utterly captivated... I'm certain it will garner the usual 30 views! Hahaha.

content:
This I did over the weekend:

Half of my laundry
Changed the sheets
Medicated the cat
Watched the cat's recovery
Grocery shopping
Workout (heavy) at the gym
Ordered some camera lenses for the staycation next week
Ordered a new light weight comforter
Listen to the rainfall
Updated my Google Docs personal journal
Nap a lot

Things I should have done over the weekend:

Clean the garage
Sharpen the chainsaw
Organize and throw out or donate old clothing
Done the other half of my laundry
Clean out the wood burning stove and set for another burn Gone for a short walk (hike)
Butcher the tomato plants

content: Auditioning for a musical improv house team is tough. I've gotten the note before after auditions that I didn't stand out enough and needed to project more star power. #retrogaming #retrocomputing

Inspired by @damianogerli 's horror graphic adventure posts, I'm considering a new Vintage Vault episode. Exploring a lesser-known, yet intriguing game, 'Produce,' on a genuine Sharp X1 or PC-8801 SR (still deciding). While the game leans more towards strategy, the distinctive role we embody in the story, coupled with its unconventional mechanics, has me utterly captivated... I'm certain it will garner the usual 30 views! Hahaha.

content:
This I did over the weekend:

Half of my laundry
Changed the sheets
Medicated the cat
Watched the cat's recovery
Grocery shopping
Workout (heavy) at the gym
Ordered some camera lenses for the staycation next week
Ordered a new light weight comforter
Listen to the rainfall
Updated my Google Docs personal journal
Nap a lot

Things I should have done over the weekend:

Clean the garage
Sharpen the chainsaw
Organize and throw out or donate old clothing
Done the other half of my laundry
Clean out the wood burning stove and set for another burn Gone for a short walk (hike)
Butcher the tomato plants

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

content: Auditioning for a musical improv house team is tough. I've gotten the note before after auditions that I didn't stand out enough and needed to project more star power. But also, they're not casting individuals, they're assembling a team. So if you grab the spotlight too much, that's bad as well.

account.note:

I post a lot about improv, scifi and fantasy lit, furry stuff and just generally trying to be more comfortable with who I am.

If you want to follow me, please have at least a profile pic, a bio and some toots first. If your account is completely blank, I probably will block you as a precaution.

#retrogaming #retrocomputing

Inspired by @damianogerli 's horror graphic adventure posts, I'm considering a new Vintage Vault episode. Exploring a lesser-known, yet intriguing game, 'Produce,' on a genuine Sharp X1 or PC-8801 SR (still deciding). While the game leans more towards strategy, the distinctive role we embody in the story, coupled with its unconventional mechanics, has me utterly captivated... I'm certain it will garner the usual 30 views! Hahaha.

content:
This I did over the weekend:

Half of my laundry
Changed the sheets
Medicated the cat
Watched the cat's recovery
Grocery shopping
Workout (heavy) at the gym
Ordered some camera lenses for the staycation next week
Ordered a new light weight comforter
Listen to the rainfall
Updated my Google Docs personal journal
Nap a lot

Things I should have done over the weekend:

Clean the garage
Sharpen the chainsaw
Organize and throw out or donate old clothing
Done the other half of my laundry
Clean out the wood burning stove and set for another burn Gone for a short walk (hike)
Butcher the tomato plants

content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

content: Auditioning for a musical improv house team is tough. I've gotten the note before after auditions that I didn't stand out enough and needed to project more star power. But also, they're not casting individuals, they're assembling a team. So if you grab the spotlight too much, that's bad as well.

account.note:
A journalist in NYC. Also a goat. He/him or they/them (no preference)

I post a lot about improv, scifi and fantasy lit, furry stuff and just generally trying to be more comfortable with who I am.

If you want to follow me, please have at least a profile pic, a bio and some toots first. If your account is completely blank, I probably will block you as a precaution.

content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

#retrogaming #retrocomputing

Inspired by @damianogerli 's horror graphic adventure posts, I'm considering a new Vintage Vault episode. Exploring a lesser-known, yet intriguing game, 'Produce,' on a genuine Sharp X1 or PC-8801 SR (still deciding). While the game leans more towards strategy, the distinctive role we embody in the story, coupled with its unconventional mechanics, has me utterly captivated... I'm certain it will garner the usual 30 views! Hahaha.

In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

content: Auditioning for a musical improv house team is tough. I've gotten the note before after auditions that I didn't stand out enough and needed to project more star power. But also, they're not casting individuals, they're assembling a team. So if you grab the spotlight too much, that's bad as well.

I post a lot about improv, scifi and fantasy lit, furry stuff and just generally trying to be more comfortable with who I am.

If you want to follow me, please have at least a profile pic, a bio and some toots first. If your account is completely blank, I probably will block you as a precaution.

content:
#retrogaming #retrocomputing

Inspired by @damianogerli 's horror graphic adventure posts, I'm considering a new Vintage Vault episode. Exploring a lesser-known, yet intriguing game, 'Produce,' on a genuine Sharp X1 or PC-8801 SR (still deciding). While the game leans more towards strategy, the distinctive role we embody in the story, coupled with its unconventional mechanics, has me utterly captivated... I'm certain it will garner the usual 30 views! Hahaha.

spoiler_text: Sexual content, unsafe insane nonconsensual, some gore
content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

account.note:

#retrogaming #retrocomputing

Inspired by @damianogerli 's horror graphic adventure posts, I'm considering a new Vintage Vault episode. Exploring a lesser-known, yet intriguing game, 'Produce,' on a genuine Sharp X1 or PC-8801 SR (still deciding). While the game leans more towards strategy, the distinctive role we embody in the story, coupled with its unconventional mechanics, has me utterly captivated... I'm certain it will garner the usual 30 views! Hahaha.

spoiler_text: Sexual content, unsafe insane nonconsensual, some gore
content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

content: Auditioning for a musical improv house team is tough. I've gotten the note before after auditions that I didn't stand out enough and needed to project more star power. But also, they're not casting individuals, they're assembling a team. So if you grab the spotlight too much, that's bad as well.

account.note:
A journalist in NYC. Also a goat. He/him or they/them (no preference)

I post a lot about improv, scifi and fantasy lit, furry stuff and just generally trying to be more comfortable with who I am.

If you want to follow me, please have at least a profile pic, a bio and some toots first. If your account is completely blank, I probably will block you as a precaution.

#retrogaming #retrocomputing

Inspired by @damianogerli 's horror graphic adventure posts, I'm considering a new Vintage Vault episode. Exploring a lesser-known, yet intriguing game, 'Produce,' on a genuine Sharp X1 or PC-8801 SR (still deciding). While the game leans more towards strategy, the distinctive role we embody in the story, coupled with its unconventional mechanics, has me utterly captivated... I'm certain it will garner the usual 30 views! Hahaha.

spoiler_text: Sexual content, unsafe insane nonconsensual, some gore
content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

content: Auditioning for a musical improv house team is tough. I've gotten the note before after auditions that I didn't stand out enough and needed to project more star power. But also, they're not casting individuals, they're assembling a team. So if you grab the spotlight too much, that's bad as well.

If you want to follow me, please have at least a profile pic, a bio and some toots first. If your account is completely blank, I probably will block you as a precaution.

#retrogaming #retrocomputing

I'm certain it will garner the usual 30 views! Hahaha.

content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

content: Auditioning for a musical improv house team is tough. I've gotten the note before after auditions that I didn't stand out enough and needed to project more star power. But also, they're not casting individuals, they're assembling a team. So if you grab the spotlight too much, that's bad as well.

account.note:
A journalist in NYC. Also a goat. He/him or they/them (no preference)

I post a lot about improv, scifi and fantasy lit, furry stuff and just generally trying to be more comfortable with who I am.

If you want to follow me, please have at least a profile pic, a bio and some toots first. If your account is completely blank, I probably will block you as a precaution.

content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

content: Auditioning for a musical improv house team is tough. I've gotten the note before after auditions that I didn't stand out enough and needed to project more star power. But also, they're not casting individuals, they're assembling a team. So if you grab the spotlight too much, that's bad as well.

account.note:
A journalist in NYC. Also a goat. He/him or they/them (no preference)

I post a lot about improv, scifi and fantasy lit, furry stuff and just generally trying to be more comfortable with who I am.

If you want to follow me, please have at least a profile pic, a bio and some toots first. If your account is completely blank, I probably will block you as a precaution.

content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

content: Auditioning for a musical improv house team is tough. I've gotten the note before after auditions that I didn't stand out enough and needed to project more star power. But also, they're not casting individuals, they're assembling a team. So if you grab the spotlight too much, that's bad as well.

account.note:
A journalist in NYC. Also a goat. He/him or they/them (no preference)

I post a lot about improv, scifi and fantasy lit, furry stuff and just generally trying to be more comfortable with who I am.

If you want to follow me, please have at least a profile pic, a bio and some toots first. If your account is completely blank, I probably will block you as a precaution.

content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

spoiler_text: Sexual content, unsafe insane nonconsensual, some gore
content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

content: Auditioning for a musical improv house team is tough. I've gotten the note before after auditions that I didn't stand out enough and needed to project more star power. content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

content:
A friendly neighbour started chatting with me about the cats today. When I said two were shot in the eye, she nonchalantly implicated a neighbour who likes to shoot chickens for target practice. I suspected them already but didn't know about the chickens. I don't know if they'd poison a cat, but regardless it's clear that our friendliest ones were targeted, which honestly makes the act worse.

Still, I appreciate the chat and could have learned more if my Bahasa Indonesia was not so rudimentary.

content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

content:
A friendly neighbour started chatting with me about the cats today. When I said two were shot in the eye, she nonchalantly implicated a neighbour who likes to shoot chickens for target practice. I suspected them already but didn't know about the chickens. I don't know if they'd poison a cat, but regardless it's clear that our friendliest ones were targeted, which honestly makes the act worse.

Still, I appreciate the chat and could have learned more if my Bahasa Indonesia was not so rudimentary.

spoiler_text: Sexual content, unsafe insane nonconsensual, some gore
content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips

spoiler_text: Spoilers for Totoro and Grave of the Fireflies
content:
I've been meaning to watch Grave of the Fireflies for years and years now. I knew that it was about two kids who survive a WWII bombing in Japan, I knew it was very good and very sad.

And it was-- even knowing this, I was unprepared.

When he puts Setsuko into the straw casket, it's... it's too much. The casket is so small.

It's such an inverse My Neighbor Totoro. Their mom is in the hospital, but dies. Mei/Setsuko loses a shoe and dies.

content:
Wall Art HERE: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/w40-space-butterfly-joseph-s-giacalone.html Space Butterfly

What looks like a red butterfly in space is in reality a nursery for hundreds of baby stars, revealed in this infrared image from NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope. Officially named W40, the butterfly is a nebula - a giant cloud of gas and dust in space where new stars may form.

Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech. Additional digital enhancements by Joseph S. Giacalone.
#mastoart #buyintoart #wallart #space #science

content:
A friendly neighbour started chatting with me about the cats today. When I said two were shot in the eye, she nonchalantly implicated a neighbour who likes to shoot chickens for target practice. I suspected them already but didn't know about the chickens. I don't know if they'd poison a cat, but regardless it's clear that our friendliest ones were targeted, which honestly makes the act worse.

Still, I appreciate the chat and could have learned more if my Bahasa Indonesia was not so rudimentary.

account.note:
Thoughtfulness & compassion.

I run the Scenoptica project, where we share footage, tell stories, make documentaries, and share knowledge on ecology, science, and academia (in English and Bahasa Indonesia).

Quickly: he/him, live in #Indonesia (previously Europe/Africa); enjoy #cinema, #reading, #music, #art, and #games; played #hockey; play #drums; interested in #ecology; love #ferns but other #plants are cool too; #creativecommons member; use #linux & #kde; have a dozen rescue #cats.

content:
In the silence of the room, the hollow sound of a bottle popping open.

"What's that?" Ed snaps, exactly as Stede says "Wait, what are you giving him?"

"It will help him sleep." Roach's voice is blase

"He's already fuckin' asleep man, fuck you talking about?" Ed snaps. Somehow, Izzy hears Roach roll his eyes

"He is unconscious--there is a difference."

A long-fingered hand cup the back of Izzy's head as Roach presses the bottle to his lips
